section.title: <i>will/won't + definitely/probably
section.sectiontitle: We use will definitely + verb when we are sure something will happen. The negative is definitely won't + verb.
section.text1: I'm sure I'll be out tomorrow evening.
section.text1a: I'll definitely be out tomorrow evening.
section.sectiontitle2: We use will probably + verb when we are fairly sure something will happen. The negative is probably won't + verb.

section.title: <i>may / might
section.sectiontitle: We use may/might + verb to say that it's possible something will happen. The negative is may/might + not + verb.
section.text1: It's possible it will rain tomorrow.
section.text2: It's possible that he won't play.
